result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received call from Jason A (Racine Youthful Offender) - facility has a problem with the amended JOC which was done on 11/10/16.  Per my conversation w/Jason A & Atty Breedlove (deft's appellate counsel), an amended JOC shall be prepared reflecting 120 days of sentence credit.  In addition, a note on the amended JOC which reflects the initial confinement time was reduced to 26mos and the term of ES was enlarged by 4mos.
Initial confinement is reduced to 26 months followed by 64 months extended supervision; still totaling 7-1/2yrs.  Deft to receive credit for 518 days served as of today.  kmk
Document from defense counsel which states the deft wishes to have this hrg treated as a sentence modification hrg and wished to appear via telephone

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone.  Atty Tristan Breedlove appeared via telephone.  Document received from defense counsel which states the deft wished the court to treat this as a sentence modification hrg and wished to appear via telephone.  Brief remarks made.  Court grants the motion for sentence modification.  Original sentence of 7-1/2yrs remains in effect; however initial confinement is reduced to 26mos and ES is extended to 64mos.  Credit for 518 days as of today.  Appeal rights.  An amended JOC will be prepared.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone w/Atty Tristan Breedlove who appeared in person.  Brief arguments heard on deft's motion to seal portion of record.  Deft's motion to seal is denied.  Brief discussion heard on deft's post conviction motion.  State takes no position.  Court grants the deft's motion for reconsideration of sentence.  Defense counsel requests the Court treat this motion as a sentence modification hrg.  Court requests defense counsel to obtain a written statement from the deft on how he wishes to proceed at the next hrg; i.e. sentence modification or re-sentencing hrg & whether he wishes to waive his appearance at the next hrg and appear via telephone.  If the parties wish to appear via telephone, defense counsel will notify the clerk of the contact numbers for both herself and the deft.  Sentencing hrg set for 11/10/16 @ 2:45pm.
Dated 10/20/16 - IT IS ORDERED that the time for deciding the defendant's postconviction motion is extended to November 25, 2016.
For Extension of Time for the Trial Court to Decide the Postconviction Motion
from appellate counsel along w/DVD/voice recording of conversation between the deft and Det. Dumesic & Det. Pfeffer

Minutes:  NO FILE IN COURT.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 7-1/2yrs WSP; initial confinement of 30mos followed by 5yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or ERP.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  Appeal rights.  Credit for 120 days.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty to the charge; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 10/9/15 @ 10am
